intro: Cogswellia canbyi, commonly known as the Canby's cactus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its tall, cylindrical stems covered in spines. The plant produces clusters of bright yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. It is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained, sandy soils. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and protected species in its native habitat.
